about.name: Armada Alliance
about.description_short: Alliance of Raspberry Pi and ARM based Stake Pools.
about.description_long: The Armada alliance was formed in efforts to build a sustainable community of decentralized, low-cost, and energy-efficient stake pool operations on the Cardano blockchain 🌍🌿 All Stake Pools in this alliance run on either Raspberry Pis exclusively or on other low power consuming ARM-based machines with an average pool energy consumption of less than 40 Watts💡

items.name: Explore the idea where we set up a treasury where people can delegate to that will be automatically assigned to pools that are in need of delegation using smart contracts
Create a validation page for stake pool members of the alliance to check for missing info
Maintain Armada Alliance Official ARM-based static build using GitHub Actions and put people on a mailinglist for new releases (including pre-releases)
Release a YouTube video on how to setup a cardano node + cli & quick db sync with Docker in under 30 minutes
Explore utility tokens for delegators of our community
Mint specials tokens for delegators of our community
Simplify the registration process for new stake pools, most data already comes from metadata & extended metadata
Support metrics endpoint for stake pools that will expose basic metrics that can be shown on the website
Create a [repository](https://github.com/armada-alliance/armada-alliance) where people can register

pages.title: What is [Cardano](/en/terms/cardano.md)?
pages.description: A 3rd generation blockchain technology that seeks to change the world.

pages.title: What is [staking](/en/terms/staking.md)?
pages.description: On the [Cardano](/en/terms/cardano.md) blockchain, the ada held by wallets represents the stake in the network; the ability to use your stake to either [pledge](/en/terms/pledge.md) or delegate is one of the core elements of Cardano.

pages.title: Wat is staken?
pages.description: Op de [Cardano](/en/terms/cardano.md) blockchain vertegenwoordigt de ada die door wallets wordt gehouden het belang in het netwerk; de mogelijkheid om uw inzet te gebruiken om ofwel [belofte](/en/terms/pledge.md) of delegeren is een van de kernelementen van Cardano.

pages.title: Chadi Nassar
pages.description: Chadi Nassar is a generative artist, who makes use of trained artificial intelligence to produce his work. His work in ‘Faces 1’ reflects emotions in a raw and reflection-inducing manner. Chadi Nassar believes in the power of emotions and that is evident through the emotions that one begins to interact with his work. Art to him is the bringing out of an emotional response to a sense; it could be visual, auditory, or really any other sense that the audience chooses to engage with the work.

pages.title: Marshall
pages.description: Marshall is an NFT artist that utilizes Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) as the medium to create his works. Fundamentally, he uses the physics of fluid flow, along with flow visualization techniques to create art. His work is the perfect marriage between the fixed laws of physics and the constantly evolving imaginative mind. He likes to inject fun into his works as well, evident in his 'How-Aerodynamic-is-My...' project, where he makes customized works for people.

Ada (₳)
pages.description: The digital currency (or cryptocurrency) of the Cardano blockchain. 1 Ada = 1 million Lovelaces. Ada and Lovelace are named after the mathematician [Ada Lovelace](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ada_Lovelace).

pages.title: ACTUS
pages.description: Algorithmic Contract Types Unified Standards. A taxonomy and standard for financial contracts.

pages.title: ASIC
pages.description: An “Application Specific Integrated Circuit” is a silicon chip specifically designed to do a single task.

pages.title: Active endpoint
pages.description: An endpoint that is active on a contract application instance.

pages.title: Ada (₳)
pages.description: The digital currency (or cryptocurrency) of the Cardano blockchain. 1 Ada = 1 million Lovelaces. Ada and Lovelace are named after the mathematician [Ada Lovelace](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ada_Lovelace).

pages.title: Adalite
pages.description: A simple Cardano web wallet developed by Cardano partners Vacuumlabs.

pages.title: address
pages.description: The address of an UTXO says where the output is “going”.

pages.title: Adrestia
pages.description: Adrestia is a collection of products which makes it easier to integrate with [Cardano](/en/terms/cardano).

pages.title: Airdrop
pages.description: Airdrop is a term for marketing campaign launched by many ICOs in which they distributes their specific token to the general public.

pages.title: Alice and Bob
pages.description: Cryptographic protocols are often made clearer by considering parties A and B, or Alice and Bob, performing some protocol.

pages.title: Altcoins
pages.description: Altcoin is an abbreviation of “Bitcoin alternative”.

pages.title: Asset-group
pages.description: A collection of tokens/assets that share the same minting policy.

pages.title: Atomic swap
pages.description: Atomic swap is a technology based on smart contracts that enables the exchange of different cryptocurrencies without the need for a centralized market or other intermediaries.

pages.title: Balance wallet
pages.description: A wallet that stores your initial testnet ada balance, copied from the mainnet via the balance snapshot.

pages.title: Basho
pages.description: Fourth phase of Cardano development in which performance improvements will be integrated.
aliases: what are the phases of cardano

pages.title: Byzantine Fault Tolerance (BFT)
pages.description: Byzantine fault tolerance (BFT), is a property in the system that ensures there is resistance to certain types of failures.

pages.title: Block
pages.description: A slot that contains a set of recent transactions on a blockchain network. Each block contains data required to manage the blockchain, including an encrypted version of the previous block.

pages.title: Blockchain explorer
pages.description: An online tool for exploring the blockchain of a particular cryptocurrency, where you can watch and follow live all the transactions happening on the blockchain.

pages.title: Blockchain
pages.description: A growing list of records, called blocks, that are linked using cryptography. Each block contains a cryptographic hash of the previous block, a timestamp, and transaction data. Blockchain is a fundamental system underpinning cryptocurrencies, acting as the public transaction ledger.

pages.title: Byron
pages.description: The name of the first ‘boot strap’ phase of Cardano development. The first era of the Cardano blockchain.

pages.title: Cardano-cli-js
pages.description: This is a library, which wraps the cardano-cli with JavaScript and makes it possible to interact with the cli-commands much faster and more efficient.

pages.title: Cardano-CLI
pages.description: The command line interface from which a user can interact with the Cardano node and blockchain.
aliases: submit a transaction on cardano using the cli
